content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.38 - Executive order no. 38: establishing the task force to restructure employment, health and social services

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the State of New York's governmental structure
related to the delivery of health and human services is often inefficient and
unresponsive to the taxpayers of the State; WHEREAS, the State of New York's duplicative and partially
overlapping administrative structure wastes scarce taxpayer dollars and hinders
the State's ability to respond to current marketplace conditions; WHEREAS, the State's ability to restructure the current
welfare and health system has been hindered by inaction at the federal
level; WHEREAS, rather than being a transitional means of support, welfare has become a way of life for too many New Yorkers; WHEREAS, the mission of the Department of Labor is to
assist citizens in accessing the labor market and promote employment
opportunities in the business community; and
WHEREAS, the mission of the Department of Health is to
promote and supervise public health activities and to ensure sound and
cost-effective medical care; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby create the Task Force to Restructure

Employment, Health and Social Services (the Task Force). The Task Force shall
consist of the Director of State Operations, who shall serve as its Chairman, and thirteen members representing state agencies, county government, service
providers, public employee unions and the business community. 1. The Task Force shall: a. Through the Chairman, report to the

Governor no later than September 2, 1996 on how the programs currently under
the purview of the Department of Social Services should be realigned. b. Advise the Governor on how to efficiently
administer programs dealing with employment and cash assistance. c. Advise the Governor on how to efficiently
administer the Medicaid program. d. Advise the Governor on how to efficiently administer programs which provide
necessary supportive social services to children and families. e. Advise the Governor on the realignment of
functions other than cash assistance, employment and Medicaid that are
currently performed by the Department of Social Services. f. Advise the Governor on how to most
efficiently coordinate the realignment of health and human services programs
with federal and local governments. g. Advise the Governor regarding

Constitutional, statutory, or regulatory amendments needed to effectuate these
changes. 2. The members
of the Task Force shall receive no compensation but shall be entitled to
reimbursement for any necessary expenses incurred in connection with the
performance of their duties. Membership in the Task Force shall not constitute
public employment for the purposes of disqualification from holding of public
office or employment. 3. Every

State department, agency, division, board, bureau, commission and other entity
over which I have executive power shall provide appropriate assistance and
cooperate as necessary to enable the Task Force to fulfill its purposes. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: May 22, 1996
[FN*] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 5 (Eliot Spitzer), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra.]
